WRITING.TEXT: That actually sounds really interesting. Does it feature the same characters?
Which version?
Obviously I'm missing the reference, but I am familiar with his other works. I'll definitely have to give it a try. Thanks for your suggestion.
Will do!
Couldn't agree more, nothing detracted from the story. Enjoyed it very much.
Those sound great, I'll be sure to check them out. I recommend giving it another go, it goes quickly. I think I probably read it through in two days. Thanks for the reply :)
See also: books

WRITING.TITLE: Just finished King Solomon's Mines
WRITING.TEXT:
Being able to see past the glaring racial ignorance as a product of its time, I really enjoyed my time with it. Besides a few minor gripes, I never found it boring or drawn out.
I feel that the novel played a bit fast and loose with the deus ex machinas. A certain flock of birds would show up as soon as the party was about to starve to death, and a random pool of water shows up right before the party dies of thirst. It took me out of the story a few times.
And that ending, what? Sir Henry's brother, after all this time, just happens to be chilling in the desert with a broken foot.
All things considered, I still had a lot of fun with this book, how about you? What did you think of this book?
No books not already mentioned, but the 2004 film hotel Rwanda is a must watch
Your forehead looks like the Fertile Crescent
When do those caterpillars on your face hatch?
